attributes.action: Limit the price of fuel at Motorway Service Stations
attributes.additional_details:
The high prices charged for fuel at motorway services are disproportinate with those across the rest of the UK.

Motorway service stations, due to easy access and high sales turnover, should have the lowest prices, not the highest, for fuel in the UK.

Motorway fuel purchases are often a no-choice decision and the distributors are using the captive nature of the audience to make significant profits.

The Government should limit each petrol distribution company's Motorway Service Station price per litre to be no more than the average of all of their non-motorway service station prices.
